quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Singer
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, divine, vocalist. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This jazz singing great, often called The Divine One and Sassy”, got a start by winning an amateur contest at the Apollo Theater?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sarah Vaughan

questions.question: Which of these is the title of a popular 1963 song recorded by Elvis Presley?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Viva Las Vegas

questions.question: In the 1960s this Wisconsin-born singer quit his job as a vocational rehabilitation councilor in San Francisco and became a very popular singer on TV talk shows. He wrote and sung the theme for the TV show Moonlighting. He was the first person to win at least one Grammy in three different categories-jazz, pop, and rhythm and blues.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Al Jarreau

questions.question: Which of these is the title of a 1973 song by Elton John?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Goodbye Yellow Brick Road

questions.question: When this singer tried out for Duke Ellington’s orchestra, he commented that she could play piano only modestly and could not sing very well.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sarah Vaughan

questions.question: A fine singer and a great comedic actress, this jazz vocalist would often interrupt a song by asking a member of the audience Are you O.K., honey? She starred in Hello Dolly on Broadway but was not in the original cast.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pearl Bailey

questions.question: Who popularized the song Oh Carolina in 1993?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shaggy

questions.question: The word best describing this Illinois-born balladeer is smooth. Born in 1923, he first became popular in the 1950s and 1960s. After stints with Earl Hines and Dizzy Gillespie, his first big album was released in 1963s. It featured John Coltrane and included his famous version of Lush Life and My One and Only Love.”
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Hartman

questions.question: What rock band recorded the song Hotel California in 1976?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eagles

questions.question: What musician recorded the 1989 song Another Day in Paradise?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phil Collins

questions.question: Much admired around the world, this singer was closely associated with the song Strange Fruit,” concerning lynching. Her life story is depicted in the movie Lady Sings the Blues.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billie Holiday

questions.question: Name the Michael Jackson song from 1995 that is centered around the destruction of our planet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Earth Song

questions.question: She was born in Virginia in 1917. In 1934 her career really got started after an appearance at Harlem’s famous Apollo Theater. Who was this First Lady of Song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ella Fitzgerald

questions.question: This great vocalist, born in 1934, attended Howard University. Although she was encouraged and promoted by Miles Davis and Quincy Jones in the 1960s, she really did not hit it big until 1998 when she recorded the album I Remember Miles”. Her most popular album was 2001’s “Youre My Thrill.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shirley Horn

questions.question: This vocalist, born in 1926, was a cross between a club singer and a jazz singer. She studied piano and voice and soon became very proficient at both. She formed the Blue Flames of Paris which morphed into the Swingle Singers. Her voice can be heard on the soundtracks of Kissing Jessica Stein,” and The Squid and the Whale.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blossom Dearie

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Album and Time
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, title, destruction. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which artist recorded Sticky Fingers, the #63 album on Rolling Stones list of greatest albums?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Rolling Stones

questions.question: This album is ranked #58 on Rolling Stone magazines list of the greatest albums of all time. The album name is Beggars Banquet.  Who recorded it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Rolling Stones

questions.question: Who recorded Imagine, the #77 album on Rolling Stone magazines list of the greatest albums of all time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Lennon

questions.question: Who wrote the music and lyics for the 1956 hit show Damn Yankees?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adler and Ross

questions.question: Who recorded the album Appetite for Destruction, which was ranked #61by Rolling Stone magazine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guns n Roses

questions.question: What popular female singer covered Marc Cohns 1991 song Walking in Memphis in 1995?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cher

questions.question: Rolling Stone magazine ranked The Wall as the #87 album on the list of the greatest albums of all time. Who recorded the album?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pink Floyd

questions.question: What does the title of Madonnas song La Isla Bonita mean in English?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The beautiful island

questions.question: Rolling Stone magazine ranked The Stranger as the #67 album on their list of top albums. Who recorded this album?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billy Joel

questions.question: Who recorded the album Rocket to Russia, which was ranked #106 by Rolling Stone magazine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Ramones

questions.question: Who recorded Goodbye Yellow Brick Road, the #91 album on Rolling Stone magazines list of top albums?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elton John

questions.question: Which version of the song Georgia on My Mind became the official state song of the U.S. state of Georgia in 1979?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ray Charles version

questions.question: What is the title of the 1973 song written and performed by Tina Turner about her hometown?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nutbush City Limits

questions.question: Tommy is ranked #97 on Rolling Stone magazines list of the top 500 albums of all time.  Who released this album?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Who

questions.question: Who recorded Disraeli Gears, the #114 album on Rolling Stones list of the 500 greatest albums of all time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cream

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky and Song
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, gon, operas. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Night Fever was one of many #1 U.S. hits for this band in the 70s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bee Gees

questions.question: The Next Time I Fall was a big hit song for this duo in 1986.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peter Cetera and Amy Grant

questions.question: Finish the following lyrics from Boat Drinks, a song by Jimmy Buffett:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: keep them all warm.

questions.question: In what year was Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky appointed Professor of Music Theory and Harmony at the Moscow Conservatory?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1866

questions.question: The Mighty Handful, also known as The Mighty Five was a group of Russian composers, brought together by their aim to compose a specific kind of Russian music which differs from the music of the West. Who were the five members of this group?

options.text: Alexander Borodin, Modest Musorgsky, Nikolau Rimsky-Korsakov, Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky, Dmitri Ivan Zokrav
Mily  Balakirev, Alexander Borodin, Cesar Cui, Modest Musorgsky, Nikolai Rimsky-Korsakov
Mily Balakirev, Stanislaw Korasoff, Ivan Novogny, Nikolai Rimsky-Korsakov, Petr  Ilyich Tchaikovsky
Alexander Borodin, Cesar Cui, Modest Musorgsky, Nikolai Rimsky-Korakov, Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mily  Balakirev, Alexander Borodin, Cesar Cui, Modest Musorgsky, Nikolai Rimsky-Korsakov

questions.question: This group had a smash hit #1 U.S. hit with New Kid in Town.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Eagles

questions.question: On July 18, 1877 Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky married his conservatory student, Antonina Milyukova, but the couple separated after what period of time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: about six weeks

questions.question: Never Gonna Give You Up was the first ever hit by this singer in 1988. It was a big one at that and shot straight up the charts to #1 in the U.S.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rick Astley

questions.question: How many symphonies did Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky write?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 8

questions.question: Often regarded as the father of Russian classical music, he wrote the operas, A Life for the Tsar and Ruslan and Lyudmila.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michail Glinka

questions.question: The Night the Lights Went Out in Georgia was the only ever hit for this singer in 1973. It was so popular that it was a chart topper for an unprecedented two straight weeks.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vicki Lawrence

questions.question: Finish these lyrics from a song by Jimmy Buffett:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a lovely cruise

questions.question: Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky dedicated his violin concerto in D major, Op. 35 to which musician?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leopold Auer

questions.question: Russian composer Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky was born in Kamsko-Votkinsk, Russia, in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1840

questions.question: Complete the following lyrics from Jimmy Buffetts song Manana:

options.text: nt try to describe the scenery if youve never seen it
you just may wind up in my song.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: you just may wind up in my song.

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Band and Rock
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, tchaikovskys, widow. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovskys Piano Concerto No. 1 in B flat minor was performed in 1875, in which city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boston, Massachusetts

questions.question: This indie pop band from Scotland composed the soundtrack to the movie Storytelling (2002).  Their other albums Tigermilk (1996) and The Boy with the Arab Strap (1998) exhibit their trademark baroque pop sound with enigmatic and literate lyrics reminiscent of The Smiths.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Belle  Sebastian

questions.question: Soul Meets Body was a fairly successful modern rock track for this band named after a song performed by The Bonzo Dog Doo-Dah Band in The Beatles 1967 Magical Mystery Tour film.

options.text: I Love You But Ive Chosen Darkness

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Death Cab for Cutie

questions.question: This two person band from Detroit won Best Alternative Music Album at the 2006 Grammy Awards for their Get Behind Me Satan LP.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The White Stripes

questions.question: Which famous ballet by Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky was first performed at the Bolshoi Theatre in Moscow in 1877?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Swan Lake

questions.question: Slow Hands and Evil were modern rock hits for this NYC band formed in 1998.  Their critically acclaimed debut album was titled Turn on the Bright Lights.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Interpol

questions.question: This bands music was featured prominently in the 2004 film Garden State starring Natalie Portman and Zack Braff. Their albums include Oh, Inverted World (2001) and Chutes Too Narrow (2003).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Shins

questions.question: Upon the release of their 2001 album Is This It?, they were hailed as the saviors of rock.  Their image was on every conceivable rock magazine, and it would seem that the very fate of rock and roll was in their hands.  Which band, fronted by Julian Casablancas, had such lofty expectations put on them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Strokes

questions.question: Which wealthy Russian widow was Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovskys patron?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nadezhda von Meck

questions.question: This artist was nominated for an Oscar for his composition Miss Misery for the film Good Will Hunting.  Sadly, the resulting critical acclaim and worldwide fame would be shortlived - this artist was found dead from two stab wounds in 2003.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elliot Smith

questions.question: This Leicestershire bands signature song Club Foot has been featured in several sports video games.  They continue to produce hits in the UK with songs like Empire and L.S.F.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kasabian

questions.question: I Predict a Riot electrified the British press in 2004 - this bands energetic music seemed to recall the same punk and new wave spirit of earlier decades.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kaiser Chiefs

questions.question: This Oklahoma band has been around since 1983, but it wasnt until their 1999 album, The Soft Bulletin, that their true genius was recognized.  Since then, Wayne Coyne and his bandmates have received Grammy awards and critical acclaim (not to mention a degree of commercial success) with their follow up LPs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Flaming Lips

questions.question: In 1993 this artist left the independent labels behind in favor of Geffen Records.  Of all the record companies that courted him, Geffen offered him the least amount of money, but the greatest amount of creative freedom.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beck

questions.question: Gold Lion and Maps were successful modern rock tracks for this NYC band.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yeah, Yeah, Yeahs
